definition: son of the boss/young master of the house/your son (honorific)
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom

sentences.english: Then Master Linton has forgot the first injunction of his uncle,' I observed: `he bid us keep on the Grange land, and here we are off at once.'

sentences.english: He had many an anecdote of the gilded youth of his time.
sentences.chinese: 他有許多他那時代的闊氣少爺們的笑談。

sentences.english: The big young master is O. K. some, can be even now of six cloudy regionses but is must not be offended of main son.

sentences.english: Mr Micawber is a very clever man, Master Copperfield.

sentences.english: But the landlord had already accepted the proposal of the young master surnamed Ma, a son of a rich family.
sentences.chinese: 可祝員外早已把女兒許配給了有錢人家的少爺馬公子。

sentences.english: Young main in the yard, small left directly go in nice.

sentences.english: Being a chef, I really did it up right — brats and potato chips.

sentences.english: Master Heathcliff, much irritated, asserted her relation was false.
sentences.chinese: 希刺克厲夫少爺大爲惱火，硬說她的敘述全是假的。

sentences.english: 'Well, my dear, I hear that he's a very rich young man from the north of England.
sentences.chinese: 啊，親愛的，我聽說他是個闊少爺，英格蘭北部人。

definition: girl/servant girl/(used deprecatingly, but sometimes also as a term of endearment)
daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
(coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
to enter a door/to go in/to learn the basics of a subject/to join one's husband's household upon marriage
original/former/originally/formerly/at first/so, actually, as it turns out
we or us (including both the speaker and the person(s) spoken to)/(dialect) I or me/(dialect) (in a coaxing or familiar way) you/also pr. [za2 men5]
my (you etc) old father/polite appellation for an elderly male
Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
